XI.ii.3.B.3.h
.
Example:  Calculating the Time Limit When a Section 5103 Notice Was Sent to the Original Claimant and Has Not Expired
Situation
:
On 04/01/2019, VA received a claim for SC for a right hip condition.
On 06/15/2019, the Veteran was sent an adequate Section 5103 notice on a pending claim for right hip condition.
On 06/23/2019, the Veteran died and prior to the Veteran’s death, no additional evidence was submitted that required development.
Result
:  Since only 8 days have passed, at the time of the deceased claimant’s death, since the Section 5103 notice, allow the substitute claimant 22 days to submit evidence when providing a notice to the substitute claimant that the request for substitution has been granted.
title: M21-1, Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section B  - Substitution in Case of Death of Claimant
citation: Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section B
